definition: to advance courageously (idiom)/to press forward
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
old variant of 往[wang3]
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: While people brood , time skips ahead without looking back.
sentences.chinese: 人犹犹豫豫，时间却一往无前。

sentences.english: This army has an indomitable spirit.
sentences.chinese: 这个军队有一往无前的精神。

sentences.english: Because of a friend's help and encouragement, you will be invincible and indomitable.
sentences.chinese: 因为朋友的相助和激励，你才会战无不胜，一往无前。

sentences.english: Our duty as men is to proceed as if limits to our ability did not exist.
sentences.chinese: 我们人类的职责是一往无前，无视能力之极限。

sentences.english: Courage is the discovery that you may not win, and trying when you know you can lose.
sentences.chinese: 勇气，就是明知自己可能会输，却还是一往无前。

sentences.english: Is it the courage to act with conviction?
sentences.chinese: 是坚定信念后一往无前的勇气？

sentences.english: Stepping forth the cure For soul's demise.
sentences.chinese: 为了治愈魂灵的死亡而一往无前。

sentences.english: "To-morrow, " he said at parting, a gayety of manner adding wonderfully to his brave demeanour.
sentences.chinese: 他的欢乐的情绪使他一往无前的气概更加潇洒。

sentences.english: The New York Stock Exchange and the Nasdaq are still powering ahead.
sentences.chinese: 新的纽约证券交易所和纳斯达克仍然是一往无前。

definition: see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]
to advance bravely
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
no stronghold one cannot overcome (idiom); to conquer every obstacle/nothing one can't do/to carry everything before one
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
having high fighting spirit
unstoppable/hard to hold back
fortitude
faith/belief/conviction
see 勢不可當|势不可当[shi4 bu4 ke3 dang1]
spirit reaches to the rainbow/full of noble aspiration and daring
to shrink back/to cower
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
impossible to resist (idiom); an irresistible force
lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat/to burn one's boats
